headline.print_headline: Solid Growth Brightens Economic Outlook for 2014
headline.main: Solid Growth Brightens Economic Outlook for 2014

docs.snippet: Consumers will spend more. Government will cut less. Businesses will invest more. And more companies will hire....
docs.lead_paragraph: Consumers will spend more. Government will cut less. Businesses will invest more. And more companies will hire.

headline.print_headline: Red Bull's F1 Test Nightmare Continues
headline.main: Red Bull's F1 Test Nightmare Continues

docs.snippet: Red Bull designer Adrian Newey went back to his drawing board on Thursday after another nightmare day for the Formula One champions in pre-season testing in southern Spain....
docs.lead_paragraph: Red Bull designer Adrian Newey went back to his drawing board on Thursday after another nightmare day for the Formula One champions in pre-season testing in southern Spain.

headline.print_headline: McDonald's Worker Charged With Selling Heroin in Happy Meal Boxes
headline.main: McDonald's Worker Charged With Selling Heroin in Happy Meal Boxes

docs.snippet: A McDonald's worker accused of dealing heroin in Happy Meal boxes to customers using the code phrase "I'd like to buy a toy" was being held on bail on Thursday in Pittsburgh, a spokesman for a local prosecutor said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A McDonald's worker accused of dealing heroin in Happy Meal boxes to customers using the code phrase "I'd like to buy a toy" was being held on bail on Thursday in Pittsburgh, a spokesman for a local prosecutor said.

headline.print_headline: Beirut Suburb on High Alert After Wave of Bombings
headline.main: Beirut Suburb on High Alert After Wave of Bombings

docs.snippet: Mohammed Hussein has stacked 300 sandbags outside his coffee shop in Beirut's southern suburbs to reassure customers frightened by a wave of deadly bombings there, but business is still down by half....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mohammed Hussein has stacked 300 sandbags outside his coffee shop in Beirut's southern suburbs to reassure customers frightened by a wave of deadly bombings there, but business is still down by half.

headline.print_headline: Daimler CEO Says Renschler Cannot Join Competitor Soon
headline.main: Daimler CEO Says Renschler Cannot Join Competitor Soon

docs.snippet: Andreas Renschler, the former Daimler executive who resigned unexpectedly earlier this week, will not be able to join a competitor soon, Daimler Chief Executive Dieter Zetsche said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andreas Renschler, the former Daimler executive who resigned unexpectedly earlier this week, will not be able to join a competitor soon, Daimler Chief Executive Dieter Zetsche said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Manslaughter Charge in Rock Climber's Death in Md.
headline.main: Manslaughter Charge in Rock Climber's Death in Md.

docs.snippet: A Virginia rock climber has been indicted on a manslaughter charge, accused of killing a friend with a claw hammer at the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park in Maryland....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Virginia rock climber has been indicted on a manslaughter charge, accused of killing a friend with a claw hammer at the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park in Maryland.

headline.print_headline: Bobby Vee Braves Alzheimer's to Record Once More
headline.main: Bobby Vee Braves Alzheimer's to Record Once More

docs.snippet: Bobby Vee still has the infectious smile, bright eyes and boyish good looks of his 1960s pop idol days, when he scored such hits as "Take Good Care of My Baby," ''Rubber Ball" and "The Night Has a Thousand Eyes."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bobby Vee still has the infectious smile, bright eyes and boyish good looks of his 1960s pop idol days, when he scored such hits as "Take Good Care of My Baby," ''Rubber Ball" and "The Night Has a Thousand Eyes."
